text: The Division of Grey is an Australian electoral division in South Australia. It was set up in 1903 and is named for Sir George Grey, Governor of South Australia from 1841–45 (and later Prime Minister of New Zealand). The division covers 92% of the state. The borders of the electorate include the Western Australia, Northern Territory, Queensland and New South Wales borders, as well as the south coast. The division includes Ceduna, Port Lincoln, Whyalla, Port Augusta, Roxby Downs, Coober Pedy, Port Pirie, Kadina, Maitland, Orroroo, Peterborough, Burra and Eudunda. ==Members== Image Member Party Term Notes Alexander Poynton Labor 1903 – 14 November 1916 Previously held the Division of South Australia. Served as minister under Hughes. Lost seat Alexander Poynton National Labor 14 November 1916 – 17 February 1917 Previously held the Division of South Australia. Served as minister under Hughes. Lost seat Alexander Poynton Nationalist 17 February 1917 – 1922 Previously held the Division of South Australia. Served as minister under Hughes. Lost seat Andrew Lacey Labor 1922 – 1931 Lost seat. Later elected to the South Australian House of Assembly seat of Port Pirie in 1933 Philip McBride United Australia 1931 – 1937 Transferred to the Senate Oliver Badman Country 1937 – 1940 Previously a member of the Senate. Lost seat Oliver Badman United Australia 1940 – 1943 Previously a member of the Senate. Lost seat Edgar Russell Labor 1943 – 31 March 1963 Died in office Jack Mortimer Labor 1963 Grey by-election – 1966 Lost seat Don Jessop Liberal 1966 – 1969 Lost seat. Elected to the Senate in 1970. Laurie Wallis Labor 1969 – 1983 Retired Lloyd O'Neil Labor 1983 – 1993 Retired Barry Wakelin Liberal 1993 – 2007 Retired Rowan Ramsey Liberal 2007 – present Current member Jack Mortimer won the division in a by-election in 1963, caused by the death of Edgar Russell. ==Election results== ==Other websites== * Rowan Ramsey's website ==References== * ABC profile for Grey: 2013 * AEC profile for Grey: 2013 * Poll Bludger profile for Grey: 2013 Category:Electoral divisions of South Australia Category:1903 establishments in Australia
title: Division of Grey
